titleInfo.title: John Price Buchanan: Farmer and Politician

mods.identifier: Hoffman, Carol. "John Price Buchanan -- farmer and politician." Publication No. 21. Rutherford County Historical Society. Murfreesboro, TN [1982]

location.physicalLocation: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: Article discusses the life and career of John Price Buchanan, with an emphasis on his roles as a leading citizen of Rutherford County, a state legislator and Governor of Tennessee. John Price Buchanan was the great-grandson of Major John Buchanan, founder of Buchanan's Station in Nashville, and grandfather to James McGill Buchanan, Nobel Laureate. Included is an oral history interview of James Buchanan and James McGill Buchanan, son and nephew of John Price Buchanan, conducted by Jeff Whorley, nephew of James McGill Buchanan in 1970.
mods.accessCondition: Copyright of the author Publications of the Rutherford County Historical Society may be freely referenced and reproduced with proper attribution

relatedItem.abstract: This collection documents the family of James McGill Buchanan (1919-2013), MTSU alumnus and 1986 winner of the Nobel Prize for Economics. His family has deep roots in middle Tennessee, including an 18th-century settler of Nashville and 19th-century Governor. Mr. Buchanan earned his B.S. at Middle Tennessee State Teachers College in 1940, followed by his M.A. in Economics at UT-Knoxville and his Ph.D. at the University of Chicago.

mods.note: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
